words.definition: An accident is an unexpected undesirable event.
words.example: She had a minor car accident.

words.definition: An admiral is someone who controls many military ships.
words.example: The admiral was in charge of the entire fleet.

words.definition: An arc is a curved shape.
words.example: A rainbow is a colorful arc in the sky.

words.definition: A character is the combination of qualities that make a person unique.
words.example: He has a strong and honest character.

words.definition: vijdon
words.translation: A conscience is the part of your mind that tells you if what you are doing is right or wrong.
words.example: He had a guilty conscience after he lied.

words.definition: If something is fiery, it is burning or looks like fire.
words.example: The sunset was a fiery orange.

words.definition: Flesh is the muscle and fat on your body.
words.example: The spear pierced the animal's flesh.

words.definition: A grapefruit is a large fruit similar to an orange.
words.example: I had a grapefruit for breakfast.

words.definition: Hay is dry grass used to feed animals.
words.example: The horses eat hay in the winter.

words.definition: If you are horrified, you are very shocked or frightened.
words.example: I was horrified by the news.

words.definition: Kerosene is a type of oil used for heat or light.
words.example: We used a kerosene lamp when the power went out.

words.definition: A loop is a shape like a circle.
words.example: He made a loop in the rope.

words.definition: A paddle is a tool used to move a boat through water.
words.example: We used paddles to move the canoe.

words.definition: A raft is a flat boat made of wood or plastic.
words.example: We floated down the river on a raft.

words.definition: When something is sour, it has a sharp taste like a lemon.
words.example: Lemons are very sour.

words.definition: A stake is a sharp wooden or metal stick.
words.example: We pushed the stake into the ground.

words.definition: A steward is a person like a waiter on a ship or plane.
words.example: The steward brought us some water.

words.definition: String is a thin piece of fabric used for tying things.
words.example: He tied the box with a piece of string.

words.definition: A thorn is a sharp point on a plant.
words.example: The rose had many thorns.

words.definition: To wreck something means to destroy or ruin it.
words.example: The car was a total wreck after the accident.
